sections.title: Landlord Entry Requirements
sections.text: In Chicago, landlords must provide at least 48 hours written notice before entering a rental unit, except in emergencies. The notice must specify the date, approximate time, and purpose of entry. Entry without proper notice violates the Chicago Residential Landlord Tenant Ordinance (RLTO).

sections.title: Security Deposit Requirements
sections.text: In Chicago, security deposits are subject to strict requirements including limits on withholding, mandatory itemized deductions, and required disclosures about escrow accounts and interest. Language allowing withholding at the landlord's discretion for broad categories such as 'administrative costs' or 'other expenses' without itemization may conflict with tenant protection rules. Deposits exceeding one month's rent may also violate RLTO limits.

sections.title: Warranty of Habitability
sections.text: While tenants may be responsible for routine maintenance, landlords cannot shift responsibility for essential habitability conditions such as heat, plumbing, and code compliance. Broad language assigning repair responsibility to tenants or disclaiming repair delays may conflict with Chicago habitability protections. Landlords must maintain rental units in habitable condition with working heat (minimum 68Â°F), hot water, plumbing, and compliance with Chicago building codes.
